titleStmt.title: Popish glorying in antiquity turned to their shame Whereby is shewed, how they wrong, villifie, and disgrace, that whereunto they pretend to carry greateste reuerence: and are most guilty of that which they vpbraide vnto others. Collected and proued out of themselues, for the singular profit both of pastors and professors. By William Guild, minister at King Edward.
titleStmt.author: Guild, William, 1586-1657.

titleStmt.title: Popish glorying in antiquity turned to their shame Whereby is shewed, how they wrong, villifie, and disgrace, that whereunto they pretend to carry greateste reuerence: and are most guilty of that which they vpbraide vnto others. Collected and proued out of themselues, for the singular profit both of pastors and professors. By William Guild, minister at King Edward.
titleStmt.author: Guild, William, 1586-1657.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Robert Allot, and are to be sold in Pauls Church-yard at the signe of the blacke Beare,

notesStmt.note: Another issue, with cancel title page, of the 1626 edition.
Reproduction of the original in the Union Theological Seminary (New York, N.Y.). Library.
